messages.content: You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Landlord agrees to rent to the Tenant the apartment, municipally described as ________________________, (the 'Property'), for use as residential premises only.
The Landlord agrees to lease the Property, located at ________________________, to the Tenant for residential use only.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Subject to the provisions of this Lease, apart from the Tenant, no other persons will live in the Property without the prior written permission of the Landlord.
No one other than the Tenant may reside at the Property without the Landlord’s prior written consent.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
No guests of the Tenants may occupy the Property for longer than one week without the prior written consent of the Landlord.
Guests may not stay at the Property for more than one week without the Landlord’s written approval.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
No pets or animals are allowed to be kept in or about the Property.
Pets are not permitted on or within the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Parking space is not provided under the terms of this Lease and no vehicle may park on or about the Property.
This Lease does not include parking; vehicles may not be parked on or near the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant and members of the Tenant's household will not smoke anywhere in the Property nor permit any guests or visitors to smoke in the Property.
Smoking is strictly prohibited anywhere on the Property by the Tenant, their household, or any guests.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant and members of the Tenant's household will not vape anywhere in the Property nor permit any guests or visitors to vape in the Property.
Vaping is not allowed anywhere on the Property by the Tenant, household members, or guests.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The term of the Lease commences at 12:00 noon on April 5, 2025 and ends at 12:00 noon on April 5, 2025.
The Lease begins at 12:00 PM on April 5, 2025, and ends at 12:00 PM on April 5, 2025.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Subject to the provisions of this Lease, the rent for the Property is $________________ per month (the 'Rent').
The monthly Rent for the Property is $________________, subject to the terms of this Lease.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant will pay the Rent monthly, on or before the first (1st) day of each and every month of the term of this Lease...
The Tenant must pay the monthly Rent on or before the first (1st) day of each month during the Lease term.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Landlord agrees to rent to the Tenant the apartment, municipally described as ________________________, (the 'Property'), for use as residential premises only.
The Landlord shall lease the Property located at ________________________ to the Tenant for residential use only.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Subject to the provisions of this Lease, apart from the Tenant, no other persons will live in the Property without the prior written permission of the Landlord.
No one other than the Tenant may reside at the Property without the Landlord's prior written consent.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
No guests of the Tenants may occupy the Property for longer than one week without the prior written consent of the Landlord.
Guests may not stay at the Property for more than one week without the Landlord's prior written approval.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
No pets or animals are allowed to be kept in or about the Property.
Pets or animals are strictly prohibited on the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Parking space is not provided under the terms of this Lease and no vehicle may park on or about the Property.
This Lease does not include parking privileges, and no vehicles may be parked on or around the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Parties will complete, sign and date an inspection report at the beginning and at the end of this tenancy.
Both Parties shall complete, sign, and date an inspection report at the start and end of the tenancy.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

At all reasonable times during the term of this Lease and any renewal of this Lease, the Landlord and its agents may enter the Property to make inspections or repairs, or to show the Property to prospective tenants or purchasers in compliance with the Act.
The Landlord or authorized agents may enter the Property at reasonable times for inspections, repairs, or showings, in accordance with the Act.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

The Tenant will obtain written permission from the Landlord before doing any of the following: applying adhesive materials, or inserting nails or hooks in walls or ceilings other than two small picture hooks per wall; painting, wallpapering, redecorating or in any way significantly altering the appearance of the Property; removing or adding walls, or performing any structural alterations; installing a waterbed(s); changing the amount of heat or power normally used on the Property as well as installing additional electrical wiring or heating units; placing or exposing or allowing to be placed or exposed anywhere inside or outside the Property any placard, notice or sign for advertising or any other purpose; or affixing to or erecting upon or near the Property any radio or TV antenna or tower.
The Tenant must obtain the Landlord's written approval before making alterations to the Property, including installing fixtures, painting, structural changes, or displaying signs or antennas.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant is responsible for the payment of all utilities in relation to the Property.
The Tenant shall pay all utility expenses associated with the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

The Tenant is hereby advised and understands that the personal property of the Tenant is not insured by the Landlord for either damage or loss, and the Landlord assumes no liability for any such loss.
The Tenant acknowledges that the Landlord does not insure the Tenant's personal property and bears no responsibility for its loss or damage.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant is not responsible for insuring the Landlord's contents and furnishings in or about the Property for either damage or loss, and the Tenant assumes no liability for any such loss.
The Tenant is not liable for loss or damage to the Landlord's furnishings or contents at the Property and is not required to insure them.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant is not responsible for insuring the Property for liability insurance, and the Tenant assumes no liability for any such loss.
The Tenant has no obligation to obtain liability insurance for the Property and assumes no liability related to it.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

In the event that any action is filed in relation to this Lease, the unsuccessful Party in the action will pay to the successful Party, in addition to all the sums that either Party may be called on to pay, a reasonable sum for the successful Party's attorney fees.
If a legal dispute arises under this Lease, the losing Party shall pay reasonable attorney fees incurred by the prevailing Party.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
This Lease will be construed in accordance with and exclusively governed by the laws of the State of New York.
This Lease shall be governed solely by the laws of the State of New York.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

If there is a conflict between any provision of this Lease and the Act, the Act will prevail and such provisions of the Lease will be amended or deleted as necessary in order to comply with the Act. Further, any provisions that are required by the Act are incorporated into this Lease.
In the event of a conflict with applicable law, the Act will control, and the Lease will be modified to comply. Required provisions of the Act are incorporated by reference.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

The invalidity or unenforceability of any provisions of this Lease will not affect the validity or enforceability of any other provision of this Lease. Such other provisions remain in full force and effect.
If any provision of this Lease is found invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain fully effective.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
This Lease may only be amended or modified by a written document executed by the Parties.
Amendments to this Lease are valid only if made in writing and signed by both Parties.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

Without the prior, express, and written consent of the Landlord, the Tenant will not assign this Lease, or sublet or grant any concession or license to use the Property or any part of the Property. A consent by the Landlord to one assignment, subletting, concession, or license, will not be deemed to be a consent to any subsequent assignment, subletting, concession, or license. Any assignment, subletting, concession, or license, without the prior written consent of the Landlord, or an assignment or subletting by operation of law, will be void and will, at the Landlord's option, terminate this Lease.
The Tenant may not assign, sublet, or license use of the Property without prior written consent from the Landlord. Any unauthorized transfer will be void and may result in termination of the Lease.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

If the Property should be damaged other than by the Tenant's negligence or willful act or that of the Tenant's employee, family, agent, or visitor and the Landlord decides not to rebuild or repair the Property, the Landlord may end this Lease by giving appropriate notice.
If the Property is damaged through no fault of the Tenant and the Landlord opts not to repair or rebuild, the Lease may be terminated with proper notice.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant is not responsible for insuring the Landlord's contents and furnishings in or about the Property for either damage or loss, and the Tenant assumes no liability for any such loss.
The Tenant is not liable for loss or damage to the Landlord's furnishings or contents at the Property and is not required to insure them.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant is not responsible for insuring the Property for liability insurance, and the Tenant assumes no liability for any such loss.
The Tenant has no obligation to obtain liability insurance for the Property and assumes no liability related to it.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

In the event that any action is filed in relation to this Lease, the unsuccessful Party in the action will pay to the successful Party, in addition to all the sums that either Party may be called on to pay, a reasonable sum for the successful Party's attorney fees.
If a legal dispute arises under this Lease, the losing Party shall pay reasonable attorney fees incurred by the prevailing Party.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
This Lease will be construed in accordance with and exclusively governed by the laws of the State of New York.
This Lease shall be governed solely by the laws of the State of New York.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

If there is a conflict between any provision of this Lease and the Act, the Act will prevail and such provisions of the Lease will be amended or deleted as necessary in order to comply with the Act. Further, any provisions that are required by the Act are incorporated into this Lease.
In the event of a conflict with applicable law, the Act will control, and the Lease will be modified to comply. Required provisions of the Act are incorporated by reference.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

The invalidity or unenforceability of any provisions of this Lease will not affect the validity or enforceability of any other provision of this Lease. Such other provisions remain in full force and effect.
If any provision of this Lease is found invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain fully effective.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
This Lease may only be amended or modified by a written document executed by the Parties.
Amendments to this Lease are valid only if made in writing and signed by both Parties.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

Without the prior, express, and written consent of the Landlord, the Tenant will not assign this Lease, or sublet or grant any concession or license to use the Property or any part of the Property. A consent by the Landlord to one assignment, subletting, concession, or license, will not be deemed to be a consent to any subsequent assignment, subletting, concession, or license. Any assignment, subletting, concession, or license, without the prior written consent of the Landlord, or an assignment or subletting by operation of law, will be void and will, at the Landlord's option, terminate this Lease.
The Tenant may not assign, sublet, or license use of the Property without prior written consent from the Landlord. Any unauthorized transfer will be void and may result in termination of the Lease.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

If the Property should be damaged other than by the Tenant's negligence or willful act or that of the Tenant's employee, family, agent, or visitor and the Landlord decides not to rebuild or repair the Property, the Landlord may end this Lease by giving appropriate notice.
If the Property is damaged through no fault of the Tenant and the Landlord opts not to repair or rebuild, the Lease may be terminated with proper notice.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant will promptly notify the Landlord of any damage, or of any situation that may significantly interfere with the normal use of the Property or to any furnishings supplied by the Landlord.
The Tenant must immediately inform the Landlord of any damage or condition that may impact the proper use of the Property or its furnishings.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant will not engage in any illegal trade or activity on or about the Property.
The Tenant is prohibited from conducting any illegal activities on or around the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Parties will comply with standards of health, sanitation, fire, housing and safety as required by law.
Both Parties agree to follow all applicable health, safety, fire, and housing regulations as required by law.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

The Parties will use reasonable efforts to maintain the Property in such a condition as to prevent the accumulation of moisture and the growth of mold. The Tenant will promptly notify the Landlord in writing of any moisture accumulation that occurs or of any visible evidence of mold discovered by the Tenant. The Landlord will promptly respond to any such written notices from the Tenant.

The Parties shall make reasonable efforts to prevent moisture and mold on the Property. The Tenant must promptly notify the Landlord in writing of any moisture or visible mold, and the Landlord must respond quickly to such notice.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

If the Tenant is absent from the Property and the Property is unoccupied for a period of 4 consecutive days or longer, the Tenant will arrange for regular inspection by a competent person. The Landlord will be notified in advance as to the name, address and phone number of the person doing the inspections.

If the Property will be unoccupied for four or more consecutive days, the Tenant must arrange for inspections by a competent individual and notify the Landlord in advance with their contact information.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

At the expiration of the term of this Lease, the Tenant will quit and surrender the Property in as good a state and condition as they were at the commencement of this Lease, reasonable use and wear and tear excepted.
Upon Lease expiration, the Tenant must vacate and return the Property in its original condition, excluding normal wear and tear.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant will obey all rules and regulations of the Landlord regarding the Property.
The Tenant agrees to comply with all rules and regulations established by the Landlord for the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
All monetary amounts stated or referred to in this Lease are based in the United States Dollar.
All amounts in this Lease are stated in U.S. Dollars.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

Any waiver by the Landlord of any failure by the Tenant to perform or observe the provisions of this Lease will not operate as a waiver of the Landlord's rights under this Lease in respect of any subsequent defaults, breaches or non-performance and will not defeat or affect in any way the Landlord's rights in respect of any subsequent default or breach.
A Landlord’s waiver of any Tenant breach does not waive any future rights or breaches under this Lease.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

This Lease will extend to and be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the respective heirs, executors, administrators, successors and assigns, as the case may be, of each Party. All covenants are to be construed as conditions of this Lease.
This Lease binds and benefits each Party's successors, heirs, and assigns. All covenants are conditions of this Lease.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
All sums payable by the Tenant to the Landlord pursuant to any provision of this Lease will be deemed to be additional rent and will be recovered by the Landlord as rental arrears.
Any amounts the Tenant owes under this Lease are considered additional rent and may be recovered as unpaid rent.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Where there is more than one Tenant executing this Lease, all Tenants are jointly and severally liable for each other's acts, omissions and liabilities pursuant to this Lease.
If multiple Tenants sign this Lease, each Tenant is fully responsible for the obligations and actions of the others.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Locks may not be added or changed without the prior written agreement of both Parties, or unless the changes are made in compliance with the Act.
Locks may not be added or changed without written agreement from both Parties, unless legally required under the Act.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant will be charged an additional amount of $25.00 for each N.S.F. check or checks returned by the Tenant's financial institution.
The Tenant shall pay an additional $25.00 for each returned or non-sufficient funds (NSF) check.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.

Headings are inserted for the convenience of the Parties only and are not to be considered when interpreting this Lease. Words in the singular mean and include the plural and vice versa. Words in the masculine mean and include the feminine and vice versa.
Headings are for convenience only and shall not affect Lease interpretation. Singular includes plural, and masculine includes feminine, and vice versa.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
This Lease may be executed in counterparts. Facsimile signatures are binding and are considered to be original signatures.
This Lease may be signed in counterparts. Faxed signatures are legally binding and treated as originals.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant must keep the Property in a clean and sanitary condition at all times.
The Tenant is responsible for maintaining the Property in a consistently clean and sanitary condition.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Landlord may inspect the Property at any time without notice.
The Landlord may conduct inspections of the Property with reasonable notice, unless an emergency requires immediate access.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Rent payments must be made via check or money order only.
Rent must be paid exclusively by check or money order, as specified in this Lease.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant is responsible for removing trash from the Property on a weekly basis.
The Tenant must ensure trash is properly removed from the Property on a weekly schedule.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant may not store flammable materials on the Property.
The Tenant is prohibited from storing any flammable or hazardous materials on the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Landlord is not liable for power outages due to utility company issues.
The Landlord is not responsible for power outages caused by external utility provider failures.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant agrees not to conduct business from the Property.
The Tenant may not operate any commercial or business activities from the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Landlord may charge a late fee if rent is not received within five days after it's due.
If Rent is not received within five days of the due date, the Landlord may assess a late fee as stipulated in this Lease.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant agrees not to make loud noise that may disturb neighbors.
The Tenant must refrain from making excessive noise that may disrupt neighboring residents.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant is responsible for changing light bulbs and smoke detector batteries.
The Tenant shall maintain functional light fixtures and smoke detectors by replacing bulbs and batteries as needed.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must obtain landlord approval before installing a satellite dish.
The Tenant must receive prior written consent from the Landlord before installing any satellite dish on the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must report any water leaks immediately.
The Tenant shall promptly report any water leaks to the Landlord to prevent damage.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant is not allowed to paint any walls without permission.
The Tenant may not paint the walls without obtaining the Landlord’s written approval.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must return all keys upon vacating the Property.
Upon vacating the Property, the Tenant must return all keys to the Landlord.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Smoking is not allowed in common areas of the building.
Smoking is strictly prohibited in all shared or common areas of the building.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must test smoke detectors every six months.
The Tenant is responsible for testing all smoke detectors at least once every six months.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Landlord is not responsible for stolen mail or packages.
The Landlord is not liable for any mail or packages lost or stolen from the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must notify Landlord of extended absences over one week.
The Tenant must inform the Landlord of any planned absences from the Property exceeding one week.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
The Tenant may not block fire exits or access points.
The Tenant shall keep all fire exits and access points clear and unobstructed at all times.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Any alterations made without permission may be removed at the Tenant’s expense.
Unauthorized alterations may be removed by the Landlord, and the Tenant will bear the associated costs.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant shall maintain landscaping and lawn areas, including regular mowing and watering.
The Tenant is responsible for maintaining the lawn and landscaping, including routine mowing and watering.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must not tamper with smoke or carbon monoxide detectors.
The Tenant shall not tamper with or disable smoke or carbon monoxide detectors under any circumstance.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant may not use the balcony for storage purposes.
The Tenant is prohibited from using the balcony or patio as a storage area.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant shall not alter or disable window or door locks.
The Tenant may not modify or disable any locks on windows or doors without the Landlord’s consent.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must ensure that HVAC filters are replaced every 3 months.
The Tenant is responsible for replacing HVAC filters at least once every three months to maintain proper function.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant shall not overload electrical outlets or circuits.
The Tenant must avoid overloading electrical outlets or circuits to prevent hazards.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must not keep inoperable vehicles on the Property.
The Tenant is not permitted to keep non-functioning or inoperable vehicles on or near the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant may not install locks without landlord approval.
The Tenant must obtain written permission from the Landlord before installing any additional locks on the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant shall not keep hazardous chemicals in the dwelling unit.
The Tenant is prohibited from storing hazardous chemicals within the dwelling unit.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant may not hang clothing or rugs from windows or balconies.
The Tenant shall not display or hang clothing, rugs, or similar items from windows, balconies, or railings.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must report pest infestations immediately.
The Tenant shall promptly notify the Landlord of any pest infestation observed on the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must not block air vents or radiators with furniture.
The Tenant must keep air vents and radiators unobstructed by furniture or other items.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant shall not modify or rewire cable or internet lines without consent.
The Tenant may not alter, rewire, or extend any cable or internet lines without the Landlord’s written approval.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant agrees to prevent pipes from freezing during winter months.
The Tenant shall take reasonable measures to prevent water pipes from freezing during cold weather.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant shall not install large appliances without approval.
The Tenant must obtain the Landlord’s written consent before installing any large appliances, including dishwashers or washing machines.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must dispose of cooking oil properly and not down the drain.
The Tenant is required to dispose of cooking oil properly and is prohibited from pouring it down any drains.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must secure outdoor furniture during storms or high winds.
The Tenant must properly secure or store outdoor furniture during inclement weather to prevent damage or hazard.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must not install window coverings that are visible from the exterior without approval.
The Tenant must obtain the Landlord’s approval before installing any window coverings visible from outside the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant may not make copies of keys without landlord permission.
The Tenant is prohibited from duplicating keys to the Property without the Landlord’s prior written consent.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant agrees to keep the thermostat above 55°F during winter to prevent freezing.
The Tenant must maintain indoor temperatures above 55°F in winter to avoid pipe freezing.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must not allow yard waste to accumulate on the Property.
The Tenant shall keep the yard free from accumulated leaves, grass clippings, or debris.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must notify landlord before changing utility accounts into their name.
The Tenant must inform the Landlord before initiating changes to utility account information or service providers.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant agrees not to tamper with the sprinkler system.
The Tenant shall not interfere with or modify the sprinkler or irrigation system in any manner.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must obtain renter’s insurance and provide proof upon request.
The Tenant must maintain renter’s insurance and provide proof of coverage upon the Landlord’s request.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant shall not use charcoal or gas grills on balconies or patios.
The Tenant is prohibited from using charcoal or gas grills on balconies, patios, or within 10 feet of the building.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant agrees to notify landlord of any building code violations they become aware of.
The Tenant must promptly inform the Landlord of any known or suspected building code violations affecting the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant is responsible for clearing snow and ice from walkways adjacent to the Property.
The Tenant shall remove snow and ice from all walkways adjacent to the Property in a timely manner.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must keep drains and gutters free of debris.
The Tenant is responsible for ensuring that all drains and gutters remain clear of debris.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant may not perform repairs on vehicles on the Property.
The Tenant is prohibited from performing vehicle maintenance or repairs on the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant shall not obstruct hallways or stairwells with personal belongings.
The Tenant must keep hallways and stairwells clear of personal items and obstructions.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must notify landlord of broken appliances immediately.
The Tenant shall promptly inform the Landlord of any malfunctioning or broken appliances supplied with the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant shall not allow children to play in parking areas.
Children are not permitted to play in or around designated parking areas.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant agrees to keep all windows closed during heavy rain.
The Tenant must keep all windows securely closed during periods of heavy rain to prevent water damage.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must clean lint from dryer traps after each use.
The Tenant shall clean the dryer lint trap after each use to ensure safe operation.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant may not prop open security doors.
The Tenant is prohibited from propping open or disabling any security doors on the premises.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant shall not dispose of bulky items in regular trash bins.
The Tenant must arrange proper disposal of bulky items and may not place them in standard trash bins.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant may not allow guests to use laundry facilities.
Laundry facilities are for Tenant use only and may not be used by guests.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant shall not use illegal substances on the Property.
The use of illegal substances on the Property by the Tenant or guests is strictly prohibited.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must request permission before installing holiday decorations.
The Tenant must obtain the Landlord’s written approval before installing any holiday decorations on the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant agrees not to disturb wildlife or feed animals around the Property.
The Tenant shall not disturb wildlife or feed animals in or around the Property.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant may not obstruct emergency exits or alarms.
Emergency exits and alarms must remain unobstructed at all times by the Tenant.
You are a legal assistant. Rewrite clauses to be clearer and more professional.
Tenant must report suspicious activity to landlord or authorities.
